intro: Rochea cymosa, commonly known as the mountain cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often growing in high-altitude regions. Rochea cymosa is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
